newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian stocks extend gains by close.
newsitem.headline: Australian stocks extend gains by close.

text.p: Australian shares extended their gains in the afternoon to close higher on Friday as modest bargain hunting emerged after Thursday's weakness.
The All Ordinaries index climbed 15.4 points to 2,362.1.

Brokers said the return of some buying confidence, as investors considered the yields on offer, had led to a stronger showing after Thursday's perverse reaction to the local interest rate reduction and Wall Street's surge.
"It's quite an improvement," said broker Robert Cameron of brokerage Cameron Securities, adding that the market seemed to be more settled after running ahead of itself ahead of Wednesday's rate cut.
"There was probably an over-reaction ahead of the interest rate cut. People have settled down and adjusted to it and seen there is still some reasonable yields out there."

Standouts were few, although listed stockbroker McIntosh Securities caught the eye, jumping 15 cents to A$1.25 (US$0.98), its highest level since September 1994, on speculation that U.S. broker Merrill Lynch was eyeing it as a takeover target.
Near term outlook was seen mixed with much dependent on how the local market would weather a Wall Street correcting from its current record levels.
Rises outnumbered falls by a ratio of about eight to five, while about 31 percent of stocks traded remained steady.
